e4: Switching to the new policy aligns with ethical standards of transparency and honesty in financial reporting. It mitigates potential legal and reputational risks associated with biased reporting, fostering trust with all investors. Although investors accustomed to the existing bias might face an adjustment period, improved credibility and compliance outweigh these short-term challenges.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy and transparency, ensuring reported figures reflect true financial performance without bias. It should foster equitable access to information for all investors, preventing any advantage to sophisticated traders over retail investors. Considerations include addressing investor communication to clearly convey changes and maintaining compliance with legal and regulatory standards.
e6: What specific strategies will be implemented to effectively communicate the change to the new policy to ensure all investors understand and adapt? How will the management team plan to monitor the impact of this policy change on investor relations and market perception?
